    • Method Detail

      • getCommand

        public static byte[] getCommand(byte[] bytes)

        Builds a Sapp formatted command, adding start, stop and checksum to the command bytes.

        Example:

        0x2A 0x30 0x30 0x30 0x31 0x30 0x30

        becomes

        STX 0x2A 0x30 0x30 0x30 0x31 0x30 0x30 ETX 0x01 0x4B

        Parameters:
        bytes - the commmand bytes

      • getChecksum

        public static byte[] getChecksum(byte[] bytes)
        Returns:
        two bytes representing low and high bytes of the checksum word

      • getHexAsciiByte

        public static byte[] getHexAsciiByte(byte value)
        Returns:
        two bytes representing a byte value in hex-ascii format

      • getHexAsciiWord

        public static byte[] getHexAsciiWord(int value)
        Returns:
        four bytes representing a word value in hex-ascii format

      • getHexAsciiCodeFromByte

        public static byte getHexAsciiCodeFromByte(byte value)
        Returns:
        hex-ascii value from byte

      • getByteFromHexAsciiCode

        public static byte getByteFromHexAsciiCode(byte hexAscii)
        Returns:
        byte value from byte in hex-ascii

      • byteToUnsigned

        public static int byteToUnsigned(byte value)
        Returns:
        int value from byte as if it were unsigned (0-255)

      • prettyPrint

        public static String prettyPrint(SappCommand sappCommand)
        Returns:
        a pretty formatted string of SappResponse depending on command type
